remarks: The left ideals and ring span of a ring depend only on the ring components.  Here ` W ` is expected to be either ` B ` (when closure is available) or ` _V ` (when strong equality is available).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)
statement:
lidlpropd.1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
lidlpropd.2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
lidlpropd.3 $e |- ( ph -> B C_ W ) $.
lidlpropd.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. W /\ y e. W ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
lidlpropd.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .r ` K ) y ) e. W ) $.
lidlpropd.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .r ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .r ` L ) y ) ) $.
lidlrsppropd $p |- ( ph -> ( ( LIdeal ` K ) = ( LIdeal ` L ) /\ ( RSpan ` K ) = ( RSpan ` L ) ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d W x y $.
$d ph x y $.
